data.text:
70482

AAPS

103

008

College Transfer Orientation

Units

3

(Primary)

Mission

Lecture

College Transfer Orientation

CRN

70482

Section

008

Units

3

Type

Instructors

(Primary)

Location

Mission

Meeting Information

Catalog Description

An overview of the concepts and significance of factors that contribute to college transfer and success in college. Factors to be explored include social awareness, cultural identity, goal setting, educational planning, and college resources. Focus on understanding the college/university systems and on understanding of the relationship of cultural experiences and college success.

001

Ocean

Meeting Information

Catalog Description

Introduction to accounting information system and recording and reporting of business transactions with a focus on the accounting cycle, terminology, application of basic principles and theories, classified financial statements and statement analysis for decision makers. The course includes balance sheet valuations, revenue/expense recognition, and cash flows.

Fundamental concepts and applications of managerial accounting techniques in the business world. Cost determination, cost analysis and control, performance evaluation, and the preparation and use of economic information for internal management purposes.

Units

Online

Online

Intermediate Accounting

CRN

70255

Section

931

Units

5

Type

Instructors

(Primary)

Location

Online

Meeting Information

Catalog Description

Designed for students who pursue accounting beyond introductory study. A rapid review of fundamentals, with problems in valuation and presentation of assets, and liabilities, together with a study of analytical procedures. Course meets the educational requirements for the Certified Public Accountant (CPA) exam as determined by the California State Board.

Section Notes

This class has no scheduled in-person meetings and requires the use of Canvas. All coursework is completed on Canvas using an internet enabled device. This class is part of CityOnline and is 16 weeks. For course details, students must check the instructor's website.

70258

ACCT

59

501

Federal Income Tax

Units

3

(Primary)

Ocean

Lecture

Federal Income Tax

CRN

70258

Section

501

Units

3

Type

Instructors

(Primary)

Location

Ocean

Meeting Information

Catalog Description

Designed for students who want to pursue the study of tax accounting or who want to prepare their own individual tax returns. Topics include tax filing requirements, gross income, itemized deductions, capital gains and losses. Helps to prepare students to meet requirements for the Certified Public Accountant (CPA) exam.

73248

ADMJ

51

981

Juvenile Procedures

Units

3

(Primary)

Online

Online

Juvenile Procedures

CRN

73248

Section

981

Units

3

Type

Instructors

(Primary)

Location

Online

Meeting Information

Catalog Description

This course examines juvenile procedure within the administration of justice system, analyzing societal responses to juvenile crime through historical records and crime trend data. Facets of juvenile law enforcement as well as prevention, rehabilitation, and detention will be covered, with emphasis on procedural change in justice policy.

Section Notes

This class requires live online meetings that take place on Mondays from 6:10 pm – 9:00 pm. Live online meetings require the use of CityZoom, Zoom’s web conferencing platform in Canvas, using an internet enabled device. This class is part of CityOnline and is 16 weeks. For course details, students must check the instructor's website.

Concepts of Criminal Law

CRN

72148

931

Units

3

Type

(Primary)

Location

Online

Meeting Information

Catalog Description

Principles of California criminal law, including laws of arrest, search and seizure, application sections of the Constitution of the United States and relevant cases as they apply to and affect contemporary law. An understanding of the California Penal Code and other criminal statutes.

Section Notes

This class has no scheduled in-person meetings and requires the use of Canvas. All coursework is completed on Canvas using an internet enabled device. This class is part of CityOnline and is 16 weeks. For course details, students must check the instructor's website.

Lecture

Princ. & Proc. of Justice Sys.

CRN

70006

Section

590

Units

3

Type

Instructors

(Primary)

Location

Ocean

Meeting Information

Catalog Description

Comprehensive overview of the legal procedures and constitutional requirements followed by law enforcement, the courts and corrections in criminal cases. Every step of the criminal justice process from pre-arrest to appeal will be thoroughly reviewed and studied. Required for the ADMJ Major and Certificate of Achievement.

72833

ADMJ

57

001

Introduction to ADMJ

Units

3

(Primary)

Ocean

Lecture

Introduction to ADMJ

CRN

72833

Section

001

Units

3

Type

Instructors

(Primary)

Location

Ocean

Meeting Information

Catalog Description

A critical thinking exploration of historical and contemporary issues in criminal justice. Study and analysis of the core principles and components of the American criminal justice system (police, courts, and corrections), the evolution of criminal justice, criminal behavior theory, crime categories, policing models, challenges in policing, and career opportunities.
